name: ACRTaskV0
description: Buid and run container images using ACR tasks
author: Microsoft Corporation
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851275) or [see the ACR Task documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/container-registry-tasks-overview)

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource manager subscription for the deployment

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure container registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pulling container images and deploying applications to the Kubernetes cluster. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: contextPath
inputs.label: Source context path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the context to be uploaded. For release having multiple artifacts provide with artifact alias name in the path too. For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/_alias1

inputs.name: dockerfileOrTaskFile
inputs.label: Dockerfile or task file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the Dockerfile or the task template/definition file path relative to the source context

inputs.name: imageNames
inputs.label: Image names
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of the names of the Docker images in separate lines to build and push.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The collection of build arguments to be used when executing a docker build. Format: --build-arg arg1=value1 --build-arg arg2=val2

inputs.name: valuesFilePath
inputs.label: ValuesFilePath
inputs.helpMarkDown: The task values/parameters file path relative to the source context. Valid for yaml files

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run.  Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)
